page.title: 08Wayfaring and Orienteering
page.content: {Wayfaring}is a Forest Walk with a difference. Instead of following a rigid and established path, one can choose one's own route between various fixed control points, using a map as the basis of your decision. It can be as difficult or as easy as desired. {Orienteering}is merely a highly competitive variation of this. It was introduced about 15 years ago from Scandinavia. It can described as a mixture of Cross-country running and Map-reading. The object is for the competitor to navigate round a previously unknown route in the shortest possible time. To prevent "following", competitors are generally started out at one minute intervals and forests are the most popular habitat because they limit visibility.
